definition: a usually granular preparation of cassava starch used especially in puddings and as a thickening in liquid food
the small, white grains of the cassava plant
a dessert made by cooking tapioca grains usually with milk, eggs, and sugar
small pieces of starch from roots of a tropical plant used especially in puddings
a food in the form of small white grains, used in cooking for making liquids thick or mixed with milk to make a dessert
small, hard pieces of the dried and crushed root of the cassava plant, usually cooked with milk and sugar to make a sweet food:
